alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 8:44PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Garfield and western Asotin Counties through 915 PM PDT... At 843 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Troy, or 26 miles southeast of Dayton, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pomeroy, Peola, Alder Thicket Campground, Wickiup Campground, Misery Spring Campground and Spruce Spring Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains
